data.Title: Google Ads Reporting Outage
data.Description: Google is experiencing an outage affecting Google Ads reporting and some interfaces. The issue is ongoing, and Google is working on a resolution.

data.Title: Reddit Demands Payment for AI Training Data
data.Description: Reddit CEO Steve Huffman announced that the platform will block search engines like Microsoft Bing from accessing its data unless they pay for it. This move aims to prevent companies from using Reddit's content to train AI models without compensation.

data.Title: Google Search Ranking Volatility
data.Description: Google Search experienced significant ranking volatility in July, particularly on July 19th and 26th.  The fluctuations affected various sectors, including e-commerce, recipes, user-generated content, and job listings.

data.Title: Google Updates Algorithms to Demote Deepfakes
data.Description: Google announced updates to its search algorithms aimed at demoting deepfake content, particularly explicit non-consensual imagery. The changes involve ranking adjustments and improved content removal processes.

data.Title: Google Tests Sitelinks Pill Format on Desktop
data.Description: Google is experimenting with a new pill format for sitelinks in desktop search results.

data.Title: Google Merchant Center Next Introduces "More Found by Google" Reporting
data.Description: Google Merchant Center Next now includes a "More found by Google" report for product feeds, providing insights into product visibility.

data.Title: Google Knowledge Panels Testing "Videos From" Section
data.Description: Google is testing a new "videos from" section within Knowledge Panels, potentially enhancing video content visibility.

data.Title: How Google Search Indexes JavaScript: A Report
data.Description: Vercel and MERJ released a comprehensive report analyzing Google's JavaScript indexing capabilities. The study, based on over 100,000 Googlebot fetches, suggests that Google handles JavaScript effectively, comparable to traditional web pages.

data.Title: PreWriter: New AI Content Tool Launched
data.Description: BruceClayInc launched PreWriter, an AI-powered content tool designed to assist writers in researching, creating, and optimizing content for SEO.

data.Title: Microsoft Bing Adds New Commute Map Features
data.Description: Microsoft's Bing Android app now allows users to add multiple destinations beyond home and work using the Commute map feature.

data.Title: OpenAI Invests in AI App for Kids
data.Description: OpenAI invests in an AI-powered educational app for children. The app is developing technology to replicate family members' voices for a more personalized learning experience.

data.Title: New Chrome AI Features Enhance Browsing Experience
data.Description: Google Chrome introduces three new AI-powered features: Circle to Search, product comparison across tabs, and AI-enhanced history functionality. Circle to Search enables users to select an area on a webpage and receive an AI-generated overview.

data.Title: The AI Act: World's First Major AI Law Takes Effect
data.Description: The world's first comprehensive AI law comes into effect, imposing strict requirements on generative AI systems, including adherence to EU copyright law and transparency disclosures.

data.Title: Outbrain Acquires Teads in $1 Billion Deal
data.Description: Outbrain confirms the acquisition of Teads, a native advertising platform, in a deal valued at over $1 billion.

data.Title: Microsoft Recognizes OpenAI as Competitor in AI and Search
data.Description: Microsoft officially lists OpenAI, its long-term strategic partner, as a competitor in the AI and search domains. This comes after OpenAI unveiled a prototype of its search engine, SearchGPT.

data.Title: Google Search Notes Experiment Disappears
data.Description: Google's experiment with Search Notes, a feature allowing users to save and share notes within search results, has ended.

data.Title: Perplexity to Share Ad Revenue with Publishers
data.Description: Following accusations of plagiarism, Perplexity announces a revenue-sharing program for publishers. The program aims to compensate publishers whose content is featured in response to user queries.

data.Title: Apple Maps Listings Appear in Google SERPs
data.Description: Apple Maps listings are now appearing in Google Search Engine Result Pages (SERPs), potentially impacting local SEO strategies.

data.Title: Google Advises Against Using M-Dot URLs as Canonical
data.Description: Google's John Mueller reiterates that websites should not set their mobile (m-dot) URLs as canonical, even with the full implementation of mobile-first indexing. This recommendation aims to avoid potential issues for large websites.
